title: New typefaces in Wallpaper magazine
content:
I already identified their new serif face: enschede’s Lexicon. But not being able to identify that beautiful sans serif and the blocky egyptian titling face is killing me, please help!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_DSC3990_3565.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_DSC3989_3789.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_DSC3991_5262.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_DSC3998_4021.JPG)
author: rs_donsata

comments.content:
The sans is called Plakat. A search would have turned this up.

[http://www.typophile.com/node/38022](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111154/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38022 "http://www.typophile.com/node/38022")
Nice pics, Héctor! Mind if I post these on Typographica with your credit?
Hector, by the way, do you know there’s a font called Mil Mascaras?

Thanks Patty... I should have searched the topic first! I read the trhead and I didn’t know it’s a design from Crhistian Scwartz, very outstanding. I couldn’t find the Mil Mascaras font, ¿where did you see it?

Still anyone knows what’s the blocky egyptian titling face?

Stephen, of course you can use them, let me email you the originals later (they have a bit of noise because I took them at ISO 400 but still they are 6 mpx)

Héctor

Still anyone knows what’s the blocky egyptian titling face? Mr. Schwartz [wrote](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111154/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38022#comment-233182) Paul Barnes […] drew the fantastic shaded Antique that mainly shows up in the front section.
Hector - Great. Do you have one with Lexicon as the body?

Right, I missed that, thanks Florian.

Stephen, I don’t. If you want I can take a couple of shots and see if you find any use of them.

Héctor

Here they are. I’m very sorry for the big images and bad scans.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Wallpaper03_2_6035.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Wallpaper02_02_3615.jpg)

You’re welcome.

Of course, you can use these images.  
If so, I’m glad too.
